caption.p: Therapeutic Protocol for Managing COVID-19 infection

tr.td: Fever, sore throat, cough; no dyspnoea or tachypnea; saturation normal
Vitamin D 50,000 units statZinc 200 mg daily × 5 daysVitamin C 500 mg tds
Symptomatic as aboveVitamin D 50,000 units stat

Plasmoquine 400 mgBD × 1 day then400 mg daily, 5 days±Azithromycin 500 mg IVI stat then 250 mg dailyWatch QT interval(replace Ca 2+ and Mg 2+) +Zinc 200 mg BD±Lopinavir/ritonavir200 mg/50 mg 2 BDControversialDuration ~5 days dependent on clinical response
Fever, dyspnoea, tachypnea, crackles saturation<90% P/ F ratio <300hypokalaemia
Full anticoagulation ifD-dimer >1Methylprednisolone40 mg BD ORDexamethasone20 mg daily × 5 then10 mg daily × 5Correct K +
Tachypnea, cyanosis,saturation <85%, P/ F ratio <200;mechanical ventilationhypotension, hypokalaemia, organ dysfunction CRP >100 and rising;D-dimer rising;ferritin >1000
Transfer to ICUTry to avoid mechanicalventilationTry Sequential:high-flow nasal with surgicalmask or polymaskCPAP: (adequate staff PPE)Mechanical ventilationECMO if resources allow
Consider:as above: add tocilizumab (Actemra) 400 mg IVI over 60 min × one doseOr controversial:Polygam 24 g × 3 days review with expert group before use of these agents

fn.p: URT: Upper respiratory tract infection; LRT: Lower respiratory tract infection.
